topic_metadata.title: Is it possible to use hyphenation costs without justification?

posts.cooked:
I’m writing a document without justification, and would still like to occasionally use hyphenation. I could #set text(hyphenate: false) and then manually insert #{sym.hyph.soft} wherever I want a long word to be breakable, but that’s hard to read and a lot of trouble. The docs indicate that hyphenation can be tuned, but that doesn’t seem to apply for unjustified text – or am I missing something?

#set page(width: 200pt)

#let example = [This text illustrates how enabling hyphenation can improve justification.]

#set par(justify: true)
#example

#set text(hyphenate: false)
#example

#set par(justify: false)
#set text(hyphenate: true, costs: (hyphenation: 1%))
#example

#set text(hyphenate: true, costs: (hyphenation: 100000%))
#example
posts.raw:
I'm writing a document without justification, and would still like to occasionally use hyphenation. I could `#set text(hyphenate: false)` and then manually insert `#{sym.hyph.soft}` wherever I want a long word to be breakable, but that's hard to read and a lot of trouble. [The docs](https://typst.app/docs/reference/text/text/#parameters-costs) indicate that hyphenation can be tuned, but that doesn't seem to apply for unjustified text – or am I missing something?

```typ
#set page(width: 200pt)

#let example = [This text illustrates how enabling hyphenation can improve justification.]

#set par(justify: true)
#example

#set text(hyphenate: false)
#example

#set par(justify: false)
#set text(hyphenate: true, costs: (hyphenation: 1%))
#example

#set text(hyphenate: true, costs: (hyphenation: 100000%))
#example
```

posts.name: Johann Birnick
posts.cooked: Yeah indeed. Seems like a bug to me. Maybe @PgBiel knows more?
posts.raw: Yeah indeed. Seems like a bug to me. Maybe @PgBiel knows more?

posts.name: Laurenz Mädje
posts.cooked: You can set par(linebreaks: "optimized") for unjustified text. Without it, the costs will indeed have no effect.
posts.raw: You can `set par(linebreaks: "optimized")` for unjustified text. Without it, the costs will indeed have no effect.
